summary: Email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) on July 5, 2019. The correspondence discusses scheduling meetings, sharing case materials, and mentions evidence including cell phone records showing contacts with underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP representing an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in response to a grand jury subpoena. She coordinates meetings with prosecutors and confirms legal representation.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Associate attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP working with Suzanne Bloom on the grand jury subpoena matter. She assists with scheduling and communications.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of an unnamed client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Bloom is confirmed as formally retained to represent the client in connection with the SDNY grand jury subpoena.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell).

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date the subpoenaed client was to appear before the grand jury, which was adjourned and held in abeyance.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: Defense attorneys propose a meeting with prosecutors to discuss the subpoena and potential voluntary interview.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed client (context suggests Ghislaine Maxwell).
Prosecutors mention having contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls.
The defense and prosecution were negotiating a potential voluntary interview of the client in lieu of a grand jury appearance.
Several civil case docket numbers related to Epstein are referenced: 15 Civ. 7433, 17 Civ. 616, and 08 Civ. 80736.
The email chain shows coordination between defense attorneys at Winston & Strawn and federal prosecutors regarding evidence sharing and scheduling.
